polimi.reds.broker.overlay
Interface Overlay

All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericOverlay
public interface Overlay

As its name suggests, the Overlay is the component of a REDS broker in charge of managing the overlay network of brokers on top of which CBR is performed. It offers methods to add/remove neighbors and to send/receive packets (i.e., any Serializable object). Each packet has an associated subject (a String) that can be used by the upper layers to distinguish between different kind of packets (e.g., publish vs. subscribe).

An overlay can manage different queues for incoming packets, each associated with one or more subjects. This implicitly defines different traffic classes. In general a single "default" traffic class (i.e., queue) is used. The overlay offers methods to get the collection of known traffic classes and to associate a subject with a new/existing traffic class.

Finally, each REDS broker has its own, unique NodeDescriptor, which is created and managed by the Overlay component.

          The default traffic class used for packets addressed to subjects for which no different traffic class was specified.

addNeighbor

NodeDescriptor addNeighbor(java.lang.String url)
                           throws NotRunningException,
                                  java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                  AlreadyNeighborException,
                                  java.net.ConnectException
Connects to the node located at the specified URL. If everything goes right the specified node becomes a new neighbor and the NeighborAddedListeners registered are notified of the new neighbor, otherwise an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
url - the URL of the node to connect.
Returns:
the NodeDescriptor of the new neighbor.
Throws:
NotRunningException - if the topology manager is not running.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the given URL has a wrong format.
AlreadyNeighborException - if the node to add is already a neighbor of the local node.
java.net.ConnectException - if the connection fails.
See Also:
tentativelyAddNeighbor(String)

tentativelyAddNeighbor

void tentativelyAddNeighbor(java.lang.String url)
                            throws NotRunningException,
                                   java.net.MalformedURLException
Try connecting to the node located at the specified URL. If everything goes right the specified node becomes a new neighbor and the NeighborAddedListeners registered are notified of the new neighbor. If connecting with the specified node violates some constraints among those enforced by this TopologyManager, this method does nothing (it does not open the new connection and it does not notify the listeners).

Parameters:
url - the URL of the node to connect.
Throws:
NotRunningException - if the topology manager is not running.
java.net.MalformedURLException - if the given URL has a wrong format or a transport knowing the corresponding protocol (see Transport.knowsProtocol(String)) was not added.
See Also:
addNeighbor(String)

removeNeighbor

void removeNeighbor(NodeDescriptor node)
Disconnects from the specified neighbor. If everything goes right the connection is closed and the NeighborhoodChangeListeners registered are notified. If the specified node was not a neighbor of the local node, this method does nothing.

Parameters:
node - the node to disconnect.

addNeighborhoodChangeListener

void addNeighborhoodChangeListener(NeighborhoodChangeListener listener)
Registers a listener for neighborhood changes. Registers a listener for the events of adding/removing/crashing of neighbors. If the listener (i.e., a listener that equals this one) was added before, this operation has no effect.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add.

removeNeighborhoodChangeListener

void removeNeighborhoodChangeListener(NeighborhoodChangeListener listener)
Removes the given listener. Removes the first registered NeighborhoodChangeListener that equals the one passed as a parameter.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove.

the current set of neighbors.

setTrafficClass

void setTrafficClass(java.lang.String subject,
                     java.lang.String trafficClass)
Sets the traffic class to be used for packets sent to the given subject. If this is the first time the given traffic class is mentioned, a new (unbounded) queue is created. If the same subject was previously associated to a different traffic class, then the association is changed.

Parameters:
subject - the subject of packets that will be associated with the given traffic class.
trafficClass - the traffic class to be used for packets sent to the given subject.

addTrafficClass

void addTrafficClass(java.lang.String trafficClass,
                     int queueSize)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new traffic class with a queue of the given size. If queueSize is -1 than a unbounded queue is used.

Parameters:
trafficClass -
queueSize -
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the traffic class has been already created before.

addPacketListener

void addPacketListener(PacketListener listener,
                       java.lang.String subject)
Registers a listener for the arrival of new packets addressed to the given subject. If the listener (i.e., a listener that equals this one) was added before, this operation has no effect.

Parameters:
listener - the component to be notified when new packets arrive.
subject - the subject to listen for.

removePacketListener

void removePacketListener(PacketListener listener,
                          java.lang.String subject)
Removes the given listener. Removes the first PacketListener (among those registered for the given subject) that equals the one passed as a parameter.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to be removed.
subject - the subject the listener to be removed was registered to.

send

void send(java.lang.String subject,
          java.io.Serializable packet,
          NodeDescriptor recipient)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 NotConnectedException,
                 NotRunningException
Sends a packet with the specified subject to the given recipient (which must be a neighbor of the local node).

Parameters:
subject - the subject to address the packet to.
packet - the packet to send.
recipient - the receiver of the packet.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
NotConnectedException - if the recipient is not a neighbor of the local node.
NotRunningException - if the overlay is not running.
